security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and guidance for identifying performance bottlenecks. No executable code, network calls, file modifications, command execution, or environment variable access detected. This skill is safe for publishing.

content.value_statement: Code performance issues like slow queries and memory leaks are hard to identify without the right approach. This skill provides systematic methods to find and fix performance bottlenecks in any codebase.
actual_capabilities: Identify N+1 query problems in database code
Detect inefficient loops and algorithm complexity issues
Find memory leaks from uncleared event listeners and timers
Spot blocking operations and missing pagination
Analyze frontend performance issues like unnecessary re-renders
Generate detailed performance reports with fixes
limitations: Does not execute code or run profiling tools
Cannot measure actual runtime performance metrics
Analysis is limited to code patterns visible in source files
Requires readable source code to analyze

use_cases.title: Database Query Optimization
use_cases.description: Find and fix N+1 queries, missing indexes, and slow database operations in your backend code

use_cases.title: React Performance Tuning
use_cases.description: Identify unnecessary re-renders, large bundle sizes, and inefficient component patterns

use_cases.title: Algorithm Complexity Review
use_cases.description: Detect O(n²) algorithms and recommend efficient data structures like hash maps

prompt_templates.title: Basic Performance Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this code for performance issues. Look for N+1 queries, inefficient loops, memory leaks, and any anti-patterns that could slow down execution.

prompt_templates.title: Database Query Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this codebase for database performance issues. Check for N+1 queries, missing indexes, SELECT * usage, and queries that could benefit from pagination.

prompt_templates.title: Memory Leak Detection
prompt_templates.prompt: Search for potential memory leaks in this code. Look for event listeners not being cleaned up, timers not being cleared, circular references, and unbounded caches.

prompt_templates.title: Full Performance Report
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a comprehensive performance analysis of this codebase. Generate a report categorizing issues by severity: critical, high, medium. For each issue, explain the impact and suggest a fix.

output_examples.input: Analyze my UserService code for performance issues
output: • N+1 query in getUserPosts (user_service.js:45) - Makes 100+ DB queries per request
• Fix: Use eager loading with JOIN or preload associations
• O(n²) loop in processNotifications (user_service.js:120) - Quadratic time complexity
• Fix: Use a hash map for O(n) lookup instead of nested loop
• Fix: Add limit and offset parameters to prevent loading all records

best_practices: Profile before optimizing - use actual metrics to identify real bottlenecks rather than guessing
Focus on hot paths first - optimize the 20% of code that runs 80% of the time
Measure impact after changes - verify that optimizations actually improve performance
anti_patterns: Premature optimization - optimizing code without first identifying actual performance problems
Ignoring N+1 queries - each query in a loop creates a multiplicative performance problem
Using O(n²) algorithms - nested loops quickly become slow as data grows

faq.question: Which programming languages does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill works with any language. Performance patterns like N+1 queries, inefficient loops, and memory leaks apply across JavaScript, Python, Java, Ruby, and most other languages.

faq.question: What are the limits of pattern-based analysis?
faq.answer: This skill analyzes code structure and patterns. It cannot measure actual runtime performance or execute code. For real metrics, use profiling tools like Chrome DevTools, cProfile, or database query analyzers.

faq.question: How does this integrate with my IDE?
faq.answer: The skill uses Claude tools like Read, Grep, and Glob to analyze code in your workspace. It provides recommendations based on source code patterns without modifying your files.

faq.question: Is my code data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. This is a pure prompt-based skill. Code analysis happens locally through Claude tools. No data is transmitted to external servers or stored elsewhere.

faq.question: Why are my queries slow despite having indexes?
faq.answer: The skill can identify common issues like SELECT *, missing compound indexes, or queries that cannot use indexes effectively. For deep analysis, use EXPLAIN ANALYZE on your database queries.

faq.question: How is this different from profiling tools?
faq.answer: Profiling tools measure actual runtime behavior. This skill identifies code patterns that typically cause performance problems. Use both together - the skill finds issues to investigate, profilers verify the impact.
